Antipa Museum Herastrau Park IOR Park Historical Center Revolution Square Triumph Arch University Square Victory Square The Village Museum The Peoples House
One of the oldest research institutions in the field of biodiversity. Located in the north of Bucharest, it covers an area of aproximately 1 sq. kilometer. A very well preserved park, smartly maintained and constantly developed. Much of the old Bucharest that was spared from demolition. Its name commemorates the Romanian Revolution against Ceausescu’s regime in 1989. Smaller than its Paris elder brother, it is however almost equally impressive. The place of some of the most violent episodes of the 1989 revolution. Victory Square is where the seat of the Romanian Government is located.- An open-air ethnographic museum located in the Herastrau Park. A building of epic proportions in the heart of Bucharest.

Ciorba de burta Ciorba de fasole Sarmale Bulz Carnati afumati Jumari Mici Sunca afumata Porumb copt Cozonac
Besides tripe,the soup contains carrots, turnip cabbage, celery roots and beef hocks. Bean soup is one of the core foods in Romanian cuisine. Cabbage rolls are made of ground meat mixed with rice and other ingredients and rolled into cabbage leaves. Sheep cheese cooked inside a piece of "mamaliga" (boiled corn meal). To obtain smoked sausages, ground meat is pressed into pieces of animal intestine, and then placed over smoke.i Obtained by frying pieces of bacon, has a high cholesterol content. Meaning “little ones” are a kind of grilled sausages that usually come in a cylindrical shape. Smoked bacon is made from the fat found either in the abdominal area or on the back of a pig. Corn on cobs is a delicacy fondly remembered from our childhood summers spent with our grandparents in the country. To bake a truly delicious sweetbread always represents a challenge.
